Well doesn't this race swapping and washing go both ways?Apart from that - this was by far the worst of all Thor movies and potentially the worst MCU movie of all times. What a terrible burning pile of movie dung it was.Apart from that - this was by far the worst of all Thor movies and potentially the worst MCU movie of all times. What a terrible burning pile of movie dung it was.

10/10Cool bad guy with a mythological weapon. Christian Bale does a great job as always!Absolute fun with goofy moments thanks to Taika Waititi including some NZ Maori references! Kia Ora Bro!The immense enjoyment I felt watching this movie was from the beautifully alien vistas our heroes visited, intangibly emotive themes and how can you go wrong with a "Guns 'n Roses" sountrack?!Definitely worth watching multiple times!I repeat! Definitely worth watching multiple times!~~I write this in memory to my good workmate, also named Thor. He sadly passed away a day before writing this. After every movie I would tell him I liked his most recent movie and he would joke that he was glad I liked it. I am going to miss asking him where his hammer is. RIP bro.Always take care of yourself and those around you. God bless.

I really do not understand the negative reviews upon Thor: Love and Thunder, but I thought it was pretty great. Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher played as a great antagonist with good acting and the storyline was entertaining. Chris Hemsworth did not disappoint as Thor in this movie. In my opinion, I would definitely would watch it again.

Every time we say that this is the worst Marvel movie, we are surprised again that it can be even worse.At the beginning of the movie, with the humor added to it, I was expecting a popcorn movie, but gradually the quality of the movie and the story was decreasing to the point where I decided to save my popcorn!There is nothing unexpected in this series, completely predictable with a weak story, with this process that Marvel has taken, soon all the creatures of the galaxy will become superheroes or gods!They don't even have the ability to make exciting music anymore, it's a disaster that they got here from that old line-up, it's a shame that they started making this nonsense, no creativity can be seen in any of Marvel's works anymore.

Despite the promising desert opening sequence, Thor Love and Thunder is a complete mess. Although Christian Bale tries to be an engaging villain there is nothing enough to support him except the black and white sequence. Natalie portman too tries to make her part interesting with two type of performances but fails to impress. Coming to visuals, the golden temple sequence, black-white sequence are the only things to cherish.The whole movie suffers from usage of some b grade vfx and cgi effects which are evident in most scenes. The botched up pointless storyline, bad screenplay and much more leads to the downfall of the movie. None of the jokes land, all felt miserable. A lot of potential talented actors have been wasted due to such a lame idea.Whatever, the mid credits looks promising in the MCU future but this one is by far the worst disappointing movie from MCU.Rating:43/100.

This is a marvel product, knowing that I went into it knowing what to expect, I did not expect competent or even consistent story telling, deep characters or great writing, but even with expecting the usual one dimensional marvel spectacle this is still objectively poor.Think of a romancy dynamic written worse than the infamous twilight movies combined with script/screenplay and directing on par with Niel Breens creations topped off with special effects worse than "alpha build" steam greenlight scam games and that's what you get here.1:it objectively is not funny, but the only genre it could possibly be described as is "comedy", yet the entirety of the "humerous" moments come in the form of loud= funny or thor talking to and even flirting with inanimate objects, this statement is not hyperbole or thor tripping over his own tongue as if he's doing his best morty impression.2: for the first time in years a marvel movie had an actual menacing villian who was also played by a great actor, but they were completely wasted as they barely had any screen time and when they did taika was too busy making "jokes" for any of the interactions to carry any weight whatsoever, which is in it's own way impressive, taking subjects like break ups, kidnapping, hostages and cancer and having such incredibly moronic dialogue over the top that the viewer is too busy cringing to have any investment whatsoever in the subject matter is a new level of god awful writing3: the majority of the screen time revolves around a mythical powerful place that nobody has ever reached before and there is only one way to get there, only for taika to decide 15 minutes before the end to completly abandon the entirety of this set up and have it so the area is still powerful but is so easy to access that anybody, anywhere in the known galaxy can simply jump into the air and instantly teleport directly there just by thinking about it, making every single act of the villain for the first 100 minutes absolutely pointless4: without spoiling specifics it is still fair to say the ending literaly renders the entire movie moot, every single act taken by both protagonists and antagonists are for all intents and purposes retconned and nothing that happens in the movie matters in any way shape or form, which is even dumber than it sounds in text because the whole movie is based around a lore mechanic that makes anything possible, so even looking at the end choice in isolation, seperating from everything leading up to that point it is still painfully stupid because they could have very easily had their cake and ate it too, instead every other second of screentime is rendered unimportant and the act that takes place is one where a character makes a choice that sabotages their own ethos with no discernable rhyme or reason whatsoever.5: natalie only agreed to come back in the role of jane on the context of not being a damsel in distress, she wanted the character to be more than a woman who needs thor to save her, well, again I won't spoil any specifics of how this plays out, but the only 2 roles jane plays in this movie are a woman who needs thors help and a woman with a relationship with thor, that's it, there is no depth or even context beyond that, the character has not evolved or been expanded on, she is exactly the same as previous movies except with less screen time and ironically is less relevant to the premise of a thor movie despite her power up which you can see on the movie posterIt is honestly terrible, every discernable part of it is a mess from the script through the directing to the music choices that were very clearly taika's attempt at mimicing the nostalgia effect that guardians of the galaxy heavily uses but the difference is the songs and their relavance to starlord make sense, but an album from earth in the 80's means nothing as a backdrop for thor and a story revolving entirely around asgardians. I can't think of any reason to give this more than 1 star, I would argue even 1 is generous because at least other low effort marvel offerings provide some degree of escapism with mindless but well done action, this doesn't even do that, it's not a case of style over substance, this movie simply has neither.

I may be done with the Marvel cinematic universe.The whole movie just felt like a joke. It was more like one of those cheap thrown together spoff movies that Hollywood pumps out to make fun of other film franchises. Even the serious parts felt campy and like a bad comedy.Compared to prior MCU there is constant language which was never really present in prior movies over the last year.Talk of group orgies. Also new.Nudity. New.Constant and over used "inclusion". Largely new.

Just doesn't seem to "land".Despite the wonderful actors, it seems lazy, has too much going on, and is also somehow rushed.Also seems like someone thought Jar Jar Binks was a great idea, and made a new movie with that character idea in mind. That and Thor is apparently back to his childlike attitude and hasn't matured at all, mostly blundering around and seeming lost. A far cry from the character he had become, especially after his fathers death.Possibly one of the worst films in the franchise, sadly- unless you are a child maybe?Maybe this was just directed at kids, trying to entice a new generation of fans.While I cannot speak to the future, I can say this movie left a lot to be desired and was not even close to the excellence of (most) the previous movies.Heck, even the CGI seemed "low budget" at times.While I was excited to see this, it's a hard pass to watch again and I'm surprised it ever made it off the editing floor.

Where should I begin? I don't know what happened, but my god, I have the impression that this movie hates itself. There really needed to be a joke every 2 minutes, at least if they were good, but out of 100 I smiled at about 5,the goats were better than anything else in this movie, not to mention that Thor as a character is completely destroyed, a completely different character from the one I knew. Poor special effects, good villain wasted, generic story and stupid ending lead to one of the worst movies in the MCU. Thor: Love and Thunder is an unfunny joke that I don't want to remember anymore, I don't know what's going on at Marvel these days, but they seriously need to wake up!

ipc-title__text: Not a bad movie, but definitely not Waititi's best

ipc-html-content-inner-div: I don't love Marvel I worship Marvel, but watching this and recent movies and tv series, you ask yourself "did tony stark died for this" ?Unjustified Action, first 5 minutes into the movies, a man was chosen to kill all gods for no reason. Lazy actors, cheesy script, bad jokes and again sorry for that UNJUSTIFIED actions, and game of thrones season 8 type of scriptwriting.This movie was meant to begin a new chapter in marvel new phase, but to be honest it shouldn't be done in first place.Shehulk twerk, ms. Marvel is a latina muslim kid although it had no relevance no importance to the story, people will hate what I'm saying but Disney for god sake "stop making gays characters that doesn't fit, stop making black characters that doesn't fit, stop making transgender characters because you want to deliver a subliminal message.Christian Bale you are a gem, being in Marvel is good, being in this Marvel movies wasn't a smart move.

I hate the forced multiculturalism of the Thor franchise, particularly with a Norse god and his home. So yeah, with a heavy dose of a totally useless "Valkyrie" and the always "should live in Wakanda" Heimdall, you have to try really hard to get past it.If you can, this isn't a bad movie. The Jane as Thor was better explained than I thought it would, great to see Darcy, if only for a minute, and Helmsworth was great as usual. Christian Bale was awesome and interesting to see them weave in Greek mythology too, but I'm guessing if they go very far with that, I'm sure half the Greek gods will end up sassy black people as well.Some people correctly criticise that there's too much humour in this movie, but it calms down after a bit. At first I thought the movie is was going to play out like a satire of Thor, but like I said, they reign it in after a while.All in all it's worth watching - you have to take it for what it is, a dumb fantasy movie, no more no less.

ipc-title__text: Not so bad after watching a few times!
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Just edited my harsh previous review to a kinder and more forgiving one. I just watched this for the third time because honestly sometimes there is nothing else even having Disney, Prime and Netflix! I have to say that it's growing on me! Yes it's silly and hilarious but also deep and loving ! Natalie Portman is good as usual and the rest of the cast also does a good job! I guess we'll just have to look back at this version as being the silly one. The CGI are as usual amazing. I'm hoping for another instalment of the Thor saga and believe there are plenty of possibilities for a really good one ! Meanwhile I'll keep watching the existing ones!

Christian Bale in the MCU? Wow I totally forgot he was playing in this movie, his performance was incredible. Director Taika Waititi has an unique style to combine comedy + seriousness, you either join the crazy ride or you'll be left out.I had a good time with Thor 4.

ipc-title__text: Not great but not as bad as user reviews make it out to be.
The most fun I've had since Thor: Ragnarok
ipc-html-content-inner-div: This was the most fun movie I've watched, maybe since Thor: Ragnarok. This is an unabashed laugh out loud comedy, but with a lot of heart. And it ends on very high notes (including the final post credit scene) unlike Ragnarok does. (Not saying L + T is better than Ragnarok because that film was epic in scope and I possibly prefer it, if only slightly more so).In the previous Thor films, I honestly didn't think Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman had good on-screen chemistry, but that changed here. Wonderful chemistry between them. I'm glad they fixed that.The screenwriting is probably this film's strongest aspect for me. Taika Waititi & Jennifer Kaytin Robinson nailed the plot, the structure, the dialogue, and the pacing. Taika Waititi's comedic timing shined in directing. I loved the reoccurring gag with the screaming goats.Finally, that 80's rock n roll theme and the gorgeous end credits. This really dialed up the fun to 11. It's that vibe that I hoped Wonder Woman '84 was going to bring but failed miserably to deliver.As I'm getting older there are few films I will spend the time to rewatch, but 10/10 I will watch this again.

This is complete garbage. As the seconds tick by i get more and more angry watching this nonsense. Seriously what is this supposed to be? The last thor film was incredible, but this is just worthless. The me too woke things are something i thoroughly enjoy seeing in every single movie thats made these last few years. Thor wearing eyeliner is a fantastic touch to this already incredible piece of cinematic gold. My god i dont think i can get through this. The acting is awful. Its like the filming of this movie was a party and the cast didn't care to try at all. The dialog is poorly written at best. This is crap. Dont waste your time. Good lord please hollywood make some movies that are worth watching.

ipc-title__text: Not bad, but not great either
ipc-html-content-inner-div: I have given this a 7 because i have always loved Thor and there are some good elements; Gorr is menacingly scary, Korg is funny as ever and there are some beautiful visual effects. Sadly there are lots of things that if changed could have made this the best Thor movie yet.Firstly the jokes; some were on point, like the banter between Thor and Star-lord, but i think we could have all done without Beer being poured over Stormbreaker and those damn Goats. Taiki does realise we're not in 2012 anymore right?Then there's the plot holes and some are pretty big. The biggest; Gorr baiting Thor to a trap by kidnapping kids, when he believes all Gods are selfish. Great logic there Taiki.Lastly and most unforgivably, both the Guardians of the Galaxy and Gorr are both massively underused. The GOTG are widely loved and provide funnier humour than Thor, especially when together and Gorr was played so well by Bale. We really should have seen him butchering Gods, otherwise he just looks menacing but there's no context.If this movie had have been made more darker, like The Batman, and focussed on Gorr, it could have been fantastic and if the GOTG were in more of the film it could have been hilarious. Unfortunately as it is, it's simply mediocore. Lets hope Taiki doesn't ruin and more movies, Star Wars is bae for me, Waititi, i'm watching you.

Similar to Ragnarok this film was absolutely hilarious. Unlike Ragnarok it was not well balanced. Natalie Portman was great here. They actually gave her something to do. Christian Bale was great in the scenes he was in, however he was extremely underused. Overall, Love & Thunder was enjoyable but if it had been longer it could have been one of the best MCU films.

ipc-title__text: Bale good, the rest kinda weak.
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Fine seems to cover it, Disney has become fine, everything is fine. It has got to the point where if spending your time aimlessly going through your phone for 2+ hours or watching a marvel movie is a bigger waste of time.

If I want to watch a silly super hero movie I'll watch batman and Robin. That's enough.This is some weird combination of the worst from Adam Sandler and the best from Marvel (make of that what you want)They absolutely trash the characters and their archs of the Mcu for cheap laughs. You might chuckle but it feels stupid afterwards.Christian bale is goat though. Sadly they ruined Thor like they did Hulk... Urgh.

ipc-title__text: Fast pace, quick explanations, too much jokes, plot holes
ipc-html-content-inner-div: This movie moves really fast, things are quickly glanced over or just given a quick explanation. Too much jokes, I would say that having a lot of people talking and trying to be funny doesn't work. Maybe 2 out of every 5 jokes are funny. Guardians are barely in this movie so don't expect a Thor and Guardian team up.The tone is kinda inconsistent, with serious moments getting interrupted by that tradition "Marvel comedy." There is no real threat, Christian Bale is great but all he does is say stereotypical evil villain monologues. His fights scenes are good though, I will admit. He has a good backstory but his transition from grieving guy to main villain was lame and quick. It happens within the first 5 minutes. One second he is a normal guy, the very next he suddenly changes his looks an is now a super villain.Natalie Portman and Tessa Thombson are good in this movie, and they get almost as much screen time as Thor. I would say the ending involving a battle with kids and shadow monsters was kinda lame, it suddenly turns into a little kids movie. Seriously, it feels like a (ahem) "Disney movie."Overall this is a good action movie with great effect and some good acting, but if you are looking for some deep story or stuff like that, it ain't here.7/10.

ipc-title__text: Thor 4 : A Sequel for the business year.
Excessive jokes all over the story
ipc-html-content-inner-div: This episode of Thor was almost annoying because of the excessive use of jokes, even in the parts that the story should be serious. The humor is very important and very appreciated in the Marvel stories, but this one exaggerates too much.The producers must review the balance of humor and seriousness when it is required. Of course, the actors are great and so the special effects, and they saved the day.I hope the next Thor's movies show us the real pose of a hero, instead of showing smiles all the time. I just felt that I wasted my time watching this movie, and the money used was wasted so.

ipc-title__text: Some of the jokes fall flat but I enjoyed it
ipc-html-content-inner-div: The overload on humor fell flat. It was overkill. Glad to see Natalie Portman had a bigger part. Good action. Nice pacing. What accent was Russel Crowe putting on? Greek? 😆 He sounded like a Russian crime kingpin. It was laughable. Overall a good time at the theater.

ipc-title__text: Even worse than the last one, they really made the effort here
ipc-html-content-inner-div: OK Chris can't act, his great to look at and a really nice gut but... Don't put him in situations where the story &script are awful and the supporting cast dont know why they're there. The las 8 or so MCU films have slid fats. Probable starting around the time of GotG II. Lack of creativity, comfortable position that everyone;'s going to lap it up etc, whatever. This really is the lowest of low point so far. Cringeworthy lines form the outset. Everyone just going through the motions. Even the visuals are uninspired and formulaic. Why, why, why... didnt it just bomb at the box office and send a message?

This wasn't just bad, it was embarrassingly bad. It was boringly bad. What is going on with Disney? There seemed to be no story line or any substance whatsoever. Marvel used to be fun, now they're just boring and dumb. The attempts at jokes was as bad as the movie. Needless to say, I had to fast forward this one several times to be able to get past some scenes. And lo and behold, that ending - what a shocker (not).Disney needs to get back to basics. Marvel movies are about super heroes, not mamsy pamsy characters that just make one mistake after another.This one was just another huge disappointment.

It's not that bad as critics and other people said. The performances and the light atmosphere were very good. If there's a little negative thing to say is that they should have made it more serious in some parts.

ipc-title__text: THOR: Love and Thunder it'd a Frizzle
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Thanks to having Disney+ I painfully sat and watched this bomb blow up in my face, yep! It was painful, it seems I was sitting on PINS and NEEDLES. Knew I should have put them away.The question I have is this, what in hell is going on over at Marvel Studios, Their MCU Phase 4, I believe they call this version of Thor. The story writers had no vision, the script writers had a story without a vision, the Director, really had no direction for this train wreck to go. This movie is so boring, you can actually take a power nap, wake and still be bored.I thought Raggie Rock was bad, this movie is so bad it makes Ragnarok look like a masterpiece, Nah, just kidding. This movie was neither funny, or adventurous.This is one of those movies, Marvel makes to pad their already bulging bank accounts. Please stop making bad movies, but then to, I could use another power nap. Hey, if you are reading this before watching the movie, I would tell you to save your time, then to, why should I be the only one bored, and disappointed in Marvel Studios, yet again.

ipc-title__text: Have we gone from Marvel fatigue to Marvel exhaustion?
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Disney is really draining that formula dry. "Marvel fatigue" is an expression people were using long before this particular bumpy movie in the studio's history, but it's especially applicable to a time when no more than a month or two passes without some new Marvel story hitting the market that now closes the gap between movies with television spinoffs beamed straight into people's homes via Disney+. What hope do these movies have to feel fresh or exciting when they're arriving at a pace to rival the clockwork release of their comic-book source material? This one feels like a parody of itself,childish and insignificant.

ipc-title__text: 2 screaming goats and a terrible illness
ipc-html-content-inner-div: To be very frank, i had to push myself to get through this. Lost too many people due to that illness and it scares the crap out of me.So i really couldn't enjoy this this. Perhaps it was the point, with all the dark, colourless monsters and world. And perhaps it was one big metaphor.But the people i lost, who i was constantly reminded off didn't have a happy ending, or ended up in a better place. They are just gone and we are left with a black hole.So i am not sure what to make of this. I will not be watching this one again. Ever.For me it should have been more clear what this was about before i went in.

The really seems like a low point for the MCU. The premise alone is bad, especially since the movie goes out of its way to show bad gods. I was actually rooting for the god killer. Even Thor killed Zeus. The acting was amazingly bad. Most of the actors were far below their capabilities. The jokes were bad and nearly constant. Jokes were occurring even when the moment should have been serious. An example was when the children were kidnapped. Not a time for jokes but they were thrown in anyway.I stopped watching this failure half way through. I had better things lines up to watch.

ipc-title__text: Keep your kids away from this
ipc-html-content-inner-div: A bad movie by all standards. If that wasn't enough, we're continually exposed to all sorts of modern-day propaganda. I don't have to name it - you know what it is.

After the endgame all the marvel movies has became garbage with the unnecessary joke less action scenes same story nothing unique or trying something else for a change i have up on these superhero movies they suck do not watch this garbage it is a waste of time and money.

While watching the film I found that it didn't meet my expectations and I found that some moments were not very needed but they added them anyway for "comic relief". The jokes felt very odd and didn't suit what was happening, the story lacked so much and I felt like the characters have changed so much from when they were first introduced in previous movies. I understand that some characters need to grow and mature but at this point I'm starting to think that Thor is turning into a "comedy" franchise than actual storytelling. The script is bad and the characters lack depth. The visuals were good but it's 2022 and that should be expected of movies these days. Overall, I did not enjoy the film and couldn't wait for it to end, and I feel bad because my sister bought me tickets so we could watch it together.

ipc-title__text: Pure cringe. The very first Marvel movie I had to fast-forward
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Oh Lord. I could not bear watching the first 10 minutes so I had to fast-forward. Clowning the strong male superheroes so that there could be female replacements (similar to She-Hulk), almost every scene was an unfunny cringe, masculine women with suit pants, men wearing skirts (Zeus walking down the stairs like a ballerina) and with no sense of purpose. Disgusting. Clownish new MCU. I'm sure you remember the com-mie references in Doctor Strange 2 ("we go on red", "everything is free here"). Here, they used the god killing. Perhaps once the "gods" are dead, we are going to get some com-mie hero to look up to.

ipc-title__text: Christian bales great performance wasted in a joke of a film.
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Christian Bale is great, Russell Crowe has a good moment, Hemsworth is good but this movie cannot be saved from a terrible script, bad direction and stupid humour that overstays its welcome.

ipc-title__text: The least impressive in the Thor series
ipc-html-content-inner-div: The worst Thor movie factually and objectively. Even my LGBT friends weren't wowed by the movie. People are saying that it contains forced humour and they're right. At times, the humour was nonsense. I love me some humour and really loved Ragnarok but definitely Taika wanted to trigger some people instead of inclusivity. He wasn't making this movie for artistic and story purposes but to fulfill his agenda. Taika made Nebula scream and turned her character into someone who's just one scream away from getting slapped. The movie is only making money because it already has a huge fan base (people like us). Also Valkyrie calling herself king sounded stupid. Korg was extremely boring. Thor was annoying. Bale was so so good but overshadowed by forced humour and making Thor look well like Thor who could take anyone down but he couldn't even kill him himself alone. Natalie was actually really good too. I was impressed. Her actions were spectacular to watch. It was refreshing to see her wield mijolnir and she acted good. I enjoyed her Thor scenes more than Chri's Thor scenes. The children couldn't act besides the kid who plays Heimdal's son. It was a bit cring worthy to see them act. Valkyrie doesn't go to the final showdown with Gorr because she gets stabbed and says to Thor "well I think I lost my kidney so you'd have to go alone". Imagine saying this when a god butcher is hell bent on killing every god. This made absolutely no sense at all. A Wasted opportunity.

I like the flow and progression of this movie. I like the way the transitions flowed. They did a good job story boarding this. I found it entertaining and not boring. I didn't like the very beginning of the movie.I think they are making a negative comment about God? Maybe pushing other narratives.I guess if there's criticisms to this movie they are all true. I was just entertained and not bored though.So..I guess for this one I'm not getting too philosophical.

Thor :Love and Thunder has a slow kind of kick Start but has a very poor build up and not many jokes creates a seasonal downfall. Performance is also another thing, acting done my thor and Jane seems very practical performance..however Christian Bale( Gorr) did a much better job than just carrying the movie forward. Director Taika Waititi still plays a good story and his role as Korg.

Please Marvel no more Taika Waititi! This is a mess and his Thor is a mockery of the character. Was no one watching what he was doing? This story is all over the place. A literal farce. The characters are cartoonish. The acting is over the top. If I had paid to see this I would have been angry. Even seeing it for free in my own home feels wrong. The actors do their best with the nonsense they are asked say and do. These are good talented people who cannot overcome this silliness. And the woke MCU message gets old. Make some changes Marvel or go the way of DC. Sooner or later your audience will tire of this.

ipc-title__text: Thor always most powerful and never lose a battle
ipc-html-content-inner-div:
Started off well and the introductions were very nice and cool - a lot of expectations added up seeing them.The history of Gorr was changed and a very tiny backstory for him. Thor life history was narrated very comical and anyone who did not watch the previous 3 movies will understand. In fact any audience without knowing any back story can catch the concept. Mighty Thor or Lady Thor character was nicely used and good weightage for her as well. Zeus part was cool and most funniest. Valkyrie was also filling and the stone character also.Pros I felt:
Thor attitude always
Mjolnir & Strombreaker
The love part and core content speaking love
Comedy screenplay
Zeus character
BGM & musicCons would be:
Running time - below 2 hours and I'm frustrated as I wish even a 3 hour movie
Weakly designed Gorr character
Lesser time for Gorr
Villain less powerful
Lot of dark scenes - it is minimally visible in theatres
The shadow army is not worthyWhy I cried a lot on cons is because I expected Gorr like a terrific villain and he was just mummified with less preference. Even Thanos who was killing humans had such a built-up and character width - Gorr who kills Gods have just 5 mins of story.However ending was made emotional as always and good leads on the post credit scenes..

Thor Love and Thunder is a massive failure. Like Ragnarok, it doesn't take itself seriously. Unfortunately, in this case, the jokes are just not funny. So while Ragnarok carried its audience along through its humor, Love and Thunder fails to do the same, and the audience is left staring at a not funny film that doesn't believe in itself. Soon enough the characters abandon the screen and the worst risk of all superhero movies materializes: all you see is grown-up people in superhero costumes. It's embarrassing for the actors (aren't you a bit old to be wearing superhero costumes?) and by reflection, for the audience.I find that poor directors can hide their weaknesses for so long, and Takia Waititi is one such director. His most famous films, Jojo Rabbit and Thor Ragnarok were generally weak, but went by, disguised in some humor that worked okay. Without that artifice, the gaps of Waititi as a filmmaker are fully revealed in this new Thor.

I'm being generous by rating this a 2 because it sucked so badddddddddd!!! As some of the other reviewers have said, Christian Bale did an awesome job but the rest of them ughhhhh!!!! The jokes were dry as a potato chip and I wanted to turn the movie off and stop watching because it was just that bad!!!! I never cared for Natalie Portman and her acting anyway therefore to see her playing the role as the new Thor was ridiculously stupid!!! I'm so thankful that I didn't pay any money to see this movie or else I'd really be upset!!! I feel like I've been cheated out of my time for even watching this nonsense!!!! The first Thor movie was the best, no more movies should have been made after that!!!!

ipc-title__text: The rating is nearly as bad as Thor The Dark World are you serious?
Silly, Disjointed & Worst Of All, Boring
ipc-html-content-inner-div: It starts off with a drawn out & disjointed telling of how we get to a, female, Thor; destroying any remnants of the masculine fantasy & romanticism that attracted generations to the original, Marvel, Thor.Look! There's a blatant neo PC ideology (that has nothing to do with the majority of folk) forced onto the canvass & on this occasion, it doesn't sit or stick.Really disappointing effort from Taika Waititi. I'm a fan of his work, but, this film is, by far, the worst thing he's done for a mass market.Bad writing, directing, editing, acting; it's basically a bad film.3 stars is generous. Very! Generous.

ipc-title__text: Cartoonishly silly but colorful addition to the 'THOR' movies

ipc-html-content-inner-div: A stellar idea that was mishandled to the point of absurdity.This movie's flow is all over the place, seemingly schizophrenic in it's execution, unable to decide what it wants to be and wasting a story that could have been something "worthy".Marvel seems to be suffering from an identity crisis.From a soundtrack that is mishandled, further disrupting the flow with songs being misused, scenes going from deadly serious to absurd, a protagonist that although over a millennia old, acts childish and incompetent, and an antagonist that could have been a memorable epic villain, especially when it was Christian Bale playing him, to another Marvel throwaway villain.It's nothing new, as Marvel has always shied away from serious issues in their previous movies, always following the few serious moments with a comedic scene, but this is on a whole other level of farcical.Hopefully they will dump Waititi, who is simply too focused on the comedic aspects, and give a more serious director a chance at the character. This of course will be futile if they keep writing Thor as a buffoon.

ipc-title__text: Of For the Days of Phase 1
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Pros: Beautifully shot film Good FX. Nice cameos from the GotG. The kids (to not spoil) were a riot near the end. Great use of GnR tunes. Absolutely mouthwatering pit shot from Tessa Thompson (too bad not the same from Portman....remember Black Swan?).Cons: Plot was so so. Too many jokes for its own good. The goats scream was funny the first couple of times. 500 times later it was just bad. Thor is a male bimbo. Underused Bale. Crowe can't find a gym or sound Greek.I hope the next film is better. It feels like Marvel shot their shot in Phase 1 - 3 and is just floundering now. I hope they can find their footing again soon. Just throwing out content isn't going to cut it in the long run. They need to focus rather than trying to give shows to every character, etc.

ipc-title__text: To be fair it is missing something.
ipc-html-content-inner-div: However, I was entertained!It's a side ally of what most expect from an Marvel Action flick.But the comedy is fresh and hits 80% of the time if not a little too consistent.After reading many reviews I expected garbage which this is not. It's funny charming with a oddly deeply moving performance by Christian Bale.What's got everyone's knickers in a twist is so very much deeper than this film deserves ( a 2022 thing ) and I feel it's suffering because of that alone.It's not gonna win any awards but it's worth the price of admission and it got me through a large bucket of popcorn with extra butter, choc top, Tangi Fruits ( I wish) and a extra large soda water.

Somehow they (the director) turned a can't lose big budget Marvel film into a goofy movie that destroyed characters and Marvel history. I had to watch this in four separate segments because I got bored and had to turn it off a bunch of times. I finally made it through the whole movie and I'm pretty disappointed. I thought the new Dr. Strange movie was bad, but this is worse. The only redeeming part of this movie is that the special effects were still decent. Anyone who paid full price to watch this at the movies theaters must be mighty Thor pissed. If you are still waiting to watch this I'd advise waiting for it to come out on cable, so toy can watch for free.

The first and the second Thor movies are boring. But Taika Waititi change everything for the third installment. Now everybody love Thor. But after watching this one, I think Thor has lost his way.This movie amp the comedy up too much. While it's nice to see funny movie, but if it's too silly then it's no good. The third has better balance between comedic and serious scene. This one feels shallow and meaningless. Honestly without Christian Bale as God Butcher, this movie would be a disaster.But is it that bad? Not really. As usual we see Thor God of Thunder in action. He looks stronger than before. Accompanied by Korg, Valkyrie, and surprise surprise, Jane Foster who now has Thor power and wield Mjolnir. As I said Bale portraying Gorr is the best thing here. He outperform other actors and actresses. The action as good as usual. So is the CGI. Russel Crowe as Zeus is fun. And we also get to see The Guardian of the Galaxy team in action.They say Thor will return again. But I hope he will not be this silly again.

ipc-title__text: The Punch That Marvel Movies Needed
ipc-html-content-inner-div: Never before has a Marvel movie existed that contains all the elements of a Marvel Movie while being so fun, witty and laughable. Taika Waititi has made a movie which brings together the epic nature of Thor with a ridiculously funny and unbelievable script. Yes, it might seem childish and offensive to the franchise, but let yourself like it, this movie is really a work of art.
